title: China’s Hot Growth Summer Will Probably Disappoint
sub_head: Data showed that growth is bottoming out. But a strong summer rebound probably isn’t in the cards.
body:
China is through the worst of its spring slump, as megacities like Shanghai and Beijing grope toward full reopening and fiscal stimulus starts to kick in. But that doesn’t add up to a strong rebound in the third quarter.
First, the good news: May economic data released Wednesday contained two key signs of strength which may help limit the damage from Shanghai’s recent lockdown. First, infrastructure investment moved convincingly upward, rising 7.3% year-over-year in May according to HSBC , more than twice April’s tepid 2.8% gain.
